Click Next. Choose any project … Continue reading Jsoup Parsing and Traversing Document and URL ?

There are two ways to generate output using Spring MVC:

  • You can use the RESTful @ResponseBody approach and HTTP message converters, typically to return data-formats like JSON or XML. Programmatic clients, mobile apps and AJAX enabled browsers are the usual clients.
  • Alternatively you may use view resolution. Although views are perfectly capable of generating JSON and XML if you wish (more on that in my next post), views are normally used to generate presentation formats like HTML for a traditional web-application.
  • Actually there is a third possibility - some applications require both, and Spring MVC supports such combinations easily. We will come back to that right at the end.

column3: Hibernate ignores hbm2ddl settings – always set to update | Out Of Singularity
column11: Despite my best effore to enforce setting of hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto to "validate" (only), Hibernate has continously ignored this value and set this to "update". I cannot find any obvious mention about this behavior elsewhere on the internet, therefore I started debugging of Hibernate in org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate class. I found out that default setting of hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto is being…

public void init(AuthenticationManagerBuilder auth) throws Exception {
   JdbcUserDetailsManager userDetailsService = new JdbcUserDetailsManager();
   userDetailsService.setDataSource(dataSource);
   PasswordEncoder encoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();

   auth.userDetailsService(userDetailsService)
	.passwordEncoder(encoder).and().jdbcAuthentication()
	.dataSource(dataSource);
}

column3: A Bootstrap Carousel with Spring MVC and Thymeleaf
column11:
This is the third post looking at the new Posts feature on NixMash Spring. Posts will stream bits of code, links and application notes relevant to the app and to fellow Spring developers. After some changes...and then more changes...

 <div class="row row-centered" id="post">
  <div class="bs-docs-section col-lg-9 col-centered">
      <div id="message-holder">
          <div th:if="${feedbackMessage}" th:class="'messageblock hidden'"
               th:utext="${feedbackMessage}"></div>
      </div>
      <div id="post-body" th:utext="${post.postContent}">
      </div>
      <div id="post-footer">
          <div id="post-date" th:text="|Posted ${#dates.format(postCreated, 'MMMM dd, yyyy hh:mm a z')}|">
              [post date]
          </div>
          <div class="edit-link" th:if="${post.isOwner}">
             <a th:href="@{|/posts/update/${post.postId}|}">[Edit]</a>
          </div>
      </div>
  </div>
</div>

To display a "View Source" link on the Post Permalink page for LINK Post Types only we check the Post.PostType property, which is an Enum. Sampled the following two approaches. Went with the second because it was cleaner.

<div th:if="${post.postType == T(com.nixmash.springdata.jpa.enums.PostType).LINK}">
           
<div th:if="${post.postType.name() == 'LINK'}">

	  saved = postService.update(postDTO);
	}
}

column11:
/**
 * Returns the HTML <IMG> tag for the close box.
 * @private
 */
InfoBox.prototype.getCloseBoxImg_ = function () {

  var img = "";

  if (this.closeBoxURL_ !== "") {

    img  = "<img";
    img += " src='" + this.closeBoxURL_ + "'";
    img += " align=right"; // Do this because Opera chokes on style='float: right;'
    img += " style='";
    img += " position: relative;"; // Required by MSIE
    img += " cursor: pointer;";
    img += " margin: " + this.closeBoxMargin_ + ";";
    img += "'>";
  }

  return img;
};
